titles.title: Gundam G no Reconguista
G Reco
ガンダム Gのレコンギスタ
Gundam Reconguista in G
Gundam reconguista in G
高达G之复国运动

relatedanime.anime: Gundam G no Reconguista: From the Past to the Future

recommendations.recommendation:
The story was a bit hard to follow, the dialogue was awkward, the editing seems a little schizophrenic, and the two openings were lazy.
Though on the plus side, the animation was good, mech designs were very nice, character designs were great, and the voice acting was pretty decent.
Overall, it feels very rushed and might have been a great show if it was fleshed out a bit more. 26 episodes is not enough for a Gundam TV series. Watch only if you`re a die-hard Gundam fan.
One different Gundam. The average Sci-fi fan will likely love it.

anime.description: The Universal Century, with its history of colonization and wars, passes into posterity, and time flows on. Mankind enters a new age of seemingly endless peace and prosperity called the Regild Century. The year is R.C. 1014. The Capital Tower, an orbital elevator, connects earth and space. Due to its role in supplying Earth`s power by transferring Photon Batteries from space, it is worshiped with a religious fervor. http://anidb.net/ch68122 [Bellri Zenam], a cadet in the Capital Guard formed to protect Capital Tower, is participating in his first non-simulated exercise when he is attacked by the powerful but unaffiliated http://anidb.net/ch68126 [G-Self] mobile suit. He manages to capture the G-Self while piloting a http://anidb.net/ch68129 [Recten] maintenance mobile suit. However, seeing the G-Self`s pilot, a young space pirate named http://anidb.net/ch68119 [Aida Rayhunton], stirs something within him, as does the G-Self which he was sure he`d never seen before. Aida`s mission to attack Capital Tower. Bellri`s destiny as a chosen pilot of the G-Self. The truth which will shake the Regild Century. It was all the beginning of the Reconguista. Source: en.gundam.info Note: Preview screenings of first three episodes was held in 13 theaters nationwide for two weeks from August 23rd to the September 5th, 2014. The regular TV broadcast started on October 3, 2014.

externalentity.identifier: ガンダム_Gのレコンギスタ

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: pirate
tag.description: Pirates are people who attack ships on the high seas to rob others of their treasure. Well, at least usually. Other people calling themselves pirates are not unheard of, usually focusing on the freedom and romance involved in the piracy-related tropes and cliches. They may or may not be after the One Piece or a spaceship full of diamonds, too, if that`s what they see as treasure. Real-life pirates were extremely common a few centuries ago, and countries even sponsored their own pirates, called "privateers", to attack ships with flags of other countries. Nowadays, however, very few actual pirates still exist, and they rely more on terrorism and guerrilla warfare than anything else, demanding ransom in exchange for hostages instead of openly attacking the enemies with their swords. Another, more modern meaning for the word refers to people who illegally download copyrighted works they are not entitled to have a copy of. Be whichever it may, there are pirates around here. Arr, avast! Thar be pirates in these dark waters, matey!

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: space elevator
tag.description: A needle-like structure placed on the equator of a planet connecting the surface with a low planetary orbit in about 200-300km height (it may even reach out into a geostationary orbit). Very efficient way to move mass "out of" a planet`s gravity well — much more efficient than e.g. chemical rockets. Alas it is not yet possible to build a space elevator, because all know materials would be crushed under their own weight. There is a faint hope that carbon-based nano-tubes may be a usable material in the future though.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: Animeism
tag.description: Animeism is a late-night Japanese programming block established in April 2012. It is devoted to anime and broadcast each Thursday night on MBS, in a fashion similar to Fuji TV`s http://anidb.net/t3865 [noitaminA] that also airs on Thursdays. Just like noitaminA, the block airs two series back to back. From April 2015 onwards, the block was moved to Friday nights. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Aida Rayhunton
character.description: A young woman who forms part of the pirate detachment. She is one of three people who can pilot the G-Self. Using the captured G-Self, she attempts to seize a Photon Battery, but is in turn captured by Bellri. Her background is not what it seems at first. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Klim Nick
character.description: The son of Ameria`s President, he is an extremely talented mobile suit pilot with strong ambition. Piloting the Montero, he joins the pirates in an effort to rescue Aida. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Noredo Nug
character.description: A student at Saint Flower Academy, and a member of its cheerleading squad. Fond of Bellri, she goes out of her way to spend time with him. A caring, responsible individual, she looks after the amnesiac Raraiya. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Bellri Zenam
character.description: A cadet in the Capital Guard Academy, created to advance the protection of the Capital Tower. His prodigious talents carry him upward in the ranks quickly, earning a double promotion. He falls for Aida at first sight, and joins the pirates in their battle against the Capital Army. He is one of three people who can pilot the G-Self. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Manny Ambassada
character.description: Luin`s girlfriend. Like Noredo, she`s a student at Saint Flower Academy and a member of the cheerleading squad. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Raraiya Akuparl
character.description: A girl who suddenly appears on Earth piloting the G-Self. An amnesiac, she is given the name "Monday" when Captain Dellensen takes her under his protection on a Monday. She is one of three people who can pilot the G-Self. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Luin Lee
character.description: A cadet at the Capital Guard Academy. He is head of Bellri`s class. While he normally acts mature and responsible, his status as a Kuntala weighs upon him. He is Manny`s boyfriend. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: G-Self
character.description: A mysterious mobile suit, unassociated with any nation. It can only be operated by Bellri, Aida, and Raraiya. It can change backpacks to adapt to its combat zone. Changing backpacks also changes its colors. Space backpack - A backpack developed by Ameria which, inexplicably, can be used by the G-Self. Atmospheric pack - A backpack used for operations within the atmosphere. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Catsith
character.description: A flying mobile suit operated by the Capital Army. Massive back-mounted wings allow it to take to the air. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Grimoire
character.description: A mass-produced mobile suit operated by the pirates. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Recten
character.description: A mobile suit used in the maintenance of Capital Tower. It can equip a versatile range of special arm modules. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Nobell
character.description: A HAROBE-type diagnostics robot. It was a gift from Noredo to Bellri, and bears a portmanteau of their names. It`s one of Bellri`s dearest possessions. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Montero
character.description: A blue mobile suit piloted by the pirate Klim Nick. It is equipped with a special weapon called a "beam javelin". Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: G-Arcane
character.description: Aida`s personal mobile suit used by the Pirates. It is a so-called G-Class mobile suit, built from the Rose of Hermes Blueprints. It is equipped with a high-power anti-ship beam rifle. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Dellensen Samatar
character.description: An instructor at the Capital Guard Academy who is recalled to serve in the Capital Army. He pilots a Catsith and an Elf Bull against the pirates. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Kerbes Yoh
character.description: An instructor at the Capital Guard Academy. Dellensen`s subordinate. He pilots the mobile suit Recksnow. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Cahill Saint
character.description: The man behind the plan to seize Capital Tower. He attempts to rescue Aida after her capture by the Capital Guard. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Gell Trimedestus Nug
character.description: The SU-Cordist Pope. He shepherds his flock from the base of Capital Tower. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Cumpa Rusita
character.description: Holds the rank of Colonel in the Capital Guard Intelligence Division, and is deeply - but covertly - involved in the formation of the Capital Army. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Wilmit Zenam
character.description: Bellri`s mother, an Operations Director of Capital Tower. Her firm adherence to SU-Cordism leaves her with scant patience for sacrilege. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Donyell Toss
character.description: Captain of the Megafauna, he shares responsibility with Cahill for the planning and execution of the mission to seize a Photon Battery. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Elf Bull
character.description: A transforming mobile suit built by the Capital Army as a testbed for the Elf Bullock. It is piloted by Lt. Dellensen. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Elf Bullock
character.description: A mobile suit mass-produced by the Capital Army based on the results of testing with the Elf Bull. The ability to mount a massive booster unit in flight mode gives it an expanded combat radius. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Megafauna
character.description: A ship laid down by the Amerian Army as a first step toward a foothold in space. To conceal its true loyalties, it operates as a Pirate Corps carrier. It is skippered by Donyell Toss. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Jahannam
character.description: A mass-produced mobile suit operated by the Amerian Army. It can mount a wide variety of equipment depending on mission profile. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Hecate
character.description: The Amerian Army`s new mobile suit. Pilot Mick Jack is assigned the dual duties of conducting operational testing and resupplying the Megafauna. Its primary weapon is a plasma scythe. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Recksnow
character.description: A Recten customized for combat. The equipment added to its legs allows it to move while hovering. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Mask
character.description: A mysterious masked man affiliated with the Capital Army.

character.name: Jugan Meinstron
character.description: A commander in the Capital Army. He takes a hawkish view of both Ameria and Gondwan. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Becker Shadam
character.description: A hawkish officer in the Capital Army. His rank is Captain. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Mick Jack
character.description: An Amerian Army pilot. Her mission to support the Pirate Corps includes operations such as the defense of supply shipments. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Armorzagan
character.description: A large mobile armor constructed by Ameria. While intended as a test type, this testing includes combat deployment. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Gavan Magdala
character.description: Leader of his own eponymous squad of Towasanga guardsmen. Pilots a Zacks. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Flaminia Kalle
character.description: A Towasangan resistance member, dedicated to opposing Dorettes` planned "Reconguista" of Earth. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Alicant
character.description: A support craft for mobile suits fielded by Dorette forces. It is equipped with both a powerful beam cannon and large claws. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Rosenthal Kobashi
character.description: A member of the G-IT team. Pilots the Z`Gocky. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: La Gu
character.description: A noble who rules Rosario Ten, capital of Venus Globe. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Poligit
character.description: A mass-produced mobile suit operated by Rosario Ten`s "Tenpolice" guards. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Conque de Venus
character.description: A massive mobile armor developed at the G-IT Laboratory. Mobile suits can to dock and control the armor. This high-powered mobile armor is equipped with several varieties of beam weaponry, an I-field, and special ECM equipment. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: G-Rach
character.description: A mobile armor developed at the G-IT Laboratory. After it is obtained by the Megafauna, Manny takes it as she returns to Mask aboard the Space Garanden. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Yggdrasill
character.description: A gigantic, pyramid-shaped mobile armor. Supplied to Mask`s squadron after their agreement to cooperate with the G-IT team. Its most powerful weapon, the "Tender Beam", can strike at long range and over wide areas. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Kabakali
character.description: A new mobile suit supplied by the G-IT team to Mask`s squadron. Mask named it after the guardian of the Kuntala`s paradise. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Dharma
character.description: A mobile armor developed at the G-IT Laboratory. Later handed over to the Amerian Army, it is piloted by Klim Nick. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Trinity
character.description: A space-use mobile suit developed by the G-IT Laboratory and handed over to the Amerian Army. Its arms and legs can be operated as remote-control weapons, requiring unusual talent from the pilot. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Z`Gocky
character.description: A marine mobile suit from Ocean Ring. It can also be used on land and in space. Source: en.gundam.info

character.name: Zansgatt
character.description: A standard mobile suit from Venus Globe.

character.name: Mazraster
character.description: A mobile suit piloted by Kun Soon after the loss of the Grod. Has precise control of its beam whip, a whiplike beam saber. Source: en.gundam.info

episode.title: 敵はキャピタル・アーミィ
The Enemy Is the Capital Army
L`ennemie est la Capital Army
Teki wa Capital Army
メガファウナ南へ
The Megafauna Heads South
Cap au sud pour le Megafauna
Megafauna Minami e
父と母とマスクと
Mother, Father and Mask
Un père, une mère, un masque
Chichi to Haha to Mask to
キャピタル・タワー占拠
Capital Tower Occupied
La prise de la Capital Tower
Capital Tower Senkyo
突入! 宇宙戦争
Charge In! The Space War
En avant pour la guerre spatiale !
Totsunyuu! Uchuu Sensou
月から来た者
Those Who Came from the Moon
L`ennemi venu de la Lune
Tsuki kara Kita Mono
宇宙, モビルスーツ戦
Space and Mobile Suit Battles
Combat de MS dans l`espace
Uchuu, Mobile Suit Ikusa
飛べ! トワサンガへ
Fly Forth! To Towasanga
Vole vers Towasanga !
Tobe! Towasanga e
ビーナス・グロゥブの一団
The Venus Globe Gang
La bande de Venus Globe
Venus Globe no Ichidan
宇宙のカレイドスコープ
Space Kaleidoscope
Kaléidoscope spatial
Uchuu no Kaleidoscope
